title: Trial Run
description: The first episode of the series, explaining the letter anthology format. A shop girl is courted by a man whose family looks down upon her, so she feigns crassness to teach them a lesson. One of a few episodes with a laugh track.

title: The Mirror
description: A spoiled and selfish woman goes without her husband to a vacation home and is tormented by a woman escaped from a mental institution which makes her confront her own mental challenges.

title: Prisoner at One O'Clock
description: A young man is accused of murder in a small Western town, but the sheriff's wife believes him innocent, while the townspeople form a mob to storm the jail.

title: Girl on a Flagpole
description: A teacher publicly opposes a candidate, only to be romanced by him, much to the chagrin of her boyfriend.

title: Turn of the Card
description: A shipboard con artist falls for his mark.

title: Earthquake
description: A man using an iron lung who has lost hope regains his will through the efforts of his wife to keep him breathing when an earthquake causes a power failure.

title: The One That Got Away
description: The glowing, tiresome reminisces of a wife and mother about her now-famous former beau and his devotion to her comes to a head.

title: Kid Stuff
description: Two widowed parents fall in love but feel their relationship might be hampered by their lively young children.

title: The Bronte Story
description: Charlotte Bronte struggles to cope with her controlling and oppressive father even as it interferes with her courtship with and marriage to Arthur Nicholls.

title: Thanksgiving in Beaver Run
description: The kidnapping of a boy by young toughs takes an unexpected turn when one of the hoodlums befriends the boy.

title: The Faith of Chata
description: A little girl in a Mexican village falls desperately ill and places her faith in God through her patron saint, regardless of whether she survives or not.

title: The Night My Father Came Home
description: Charming holiday story about a small boy who frequents a postal station, chatting incessantly with a disillusioned laborer.

title: Hotel Irritant
description: Corporate hotel snoop Sally Webster creates unpleasant situations in a hotel to test its operation while becoming impressed with the character and ambition of hotel clerk Newton Ralston.

title: Inga
description: Indomitable Inga Helborg convinces a bank president to conditionally reverse the foreclosure of the family farm and takes labor from the prison farm by which both actions she successfully demonstrates her resolute and trusting nature.

title: Lady Killer
description: A mystery writer discovers she is marked for death.

title: Secret Answer
description: A spirited wife challenges the stodgy attitudes of researcher husband by refusing to respond to one of his survey questions: "If you had it to do all over again, would you marry the same person?"

title: Big Little Lie
description: Beverly Washburn plays a lonely schoolgirl whose decision to start a rumor about her mother turns into classroom blackmail. Jeannette Nolan portrays her stern Aunt.

title: The Hollywood Story
description: Madge Mason based on her prowess as a local actress in a small Iowa town goes to Hollywood and meets with only modest success but when it appears she is on verge of major success she has second thoughts about the price of fame.

title: A Family Out of Us
description: The son of an affluent couple, whose father has little time for him, joins the Cub Scouts.

title: Act of Faith
description: Eddie Albert plays a mild-mannered soul whose happy marriage to an earthy woman seems to be coming to an end.

title: The New York Story
description: A glamorous mother and wife who dallies with other men's attention takes her own husband and son for granted. Clever opening schoolroom sequence in which the moms comment in theirs heads about each other. The climax in which the woman's mind races with impending terror about her son's lateness might seem melodramatic, but it's all too real for many of us who worry about loved ones. Mabel Albertson of "Bewitched" and so many other series plays the PTA spokesperson.

title: Nobody's Boy
description: Fictionalized story of a Chicago juvenile delinquent who meets Jack Robbins, founder of the BBR, a boy's club that still exists today. A familiar face in one scene is the ubiquitous Argentina Brunetti, to whom Dean Martin sang "That's Amore" in "The Caddy." At the end of the story, Young introduces actor Chick Chandler and the real-life Jack Robbins.

title: The Count of Ten
description: Eddie Albert plays Tiger Tipton, a prize fighter who had promised his critically ill wife never to box again...but guess what? Jesse White appears in the kind of role he practically patented, the cigar-chomping manager. This particular entry is largely cliché, including the doctor explaining that "she can get well, but she isn't fighting enough to save herself" and Albert clearly couldn't out-box Mr. Haney, but you can look for "Happy Days'" Marion Ross as a nurse.

title: The Clara Schumann Story
description: The great composer and his concert pianist wife, whose seemingly idyllic marriage descends into mental breakdown.

title: Son, This Is Your Father
description: Flashbacks tell the story of a charming but irresponsible ex-husband who re-enters the lives of his wife and son. The father/son relationship is similar to that of Gloria's son and her first husband on the series, "Modern Family." In this episode, Young's character's name is "Ginger," a decade before her co-star, Alan Hale Jr., addressed Tina Louise by the name on "Gilligan's Island."

title: The First Man to Ask Her
description: Offbeat comic tale of a sheltered young woman whose house is turned upside down by an eccentric lady, her cowboy son -- and his horse. Jock Mahoney makes the first of his many appearances in the series, playing nephew "Andy" to Frances Bavier, who would ironically play Aunt Bee to Andy Griffith less than a decade later.

title: Man's Estate
description: Profile of a teenager who wants to be treated as an adult.

title: Forest Ranger
description: A forest ranger's wife unknowing allows into her house an escaped convict who seeks revenge on her husband.

title: Dr. Juliet
description: A doctor unravels the mysterious circumstances and suspects surrounding the near-death of a young heiress.

title: Double Trouble
description: Granite jawed Hugh O'Brien, clearly enjoying a change of pace from his usual rugged roles, plays a shy cartoonist whose heroism is awakened by a fraud scandal involving a woman and a his exact double.

title: The Lamp
description: What seems to be Aladdin's Lamp also seems to be fulfilling the fondest wishes of a young couple.

title: You're Driving Me Crazy
description: A couple finds themselves terrorized by a disturbed man who rear ends their car. There is some genuine suspense in this episode and warrants attention in that it comes years before Alfred Hitchcock Presents and other such anthologies.

title: Beyond a Reasonable Doubt
description: This familiar plot of a lone holdout juror benefits from extreme unusual close-ups, montages and double-exposures to "open up" the drama beyond the single room setting.

title: On Your Honor, Your Honor
description: An idealistic widow, whose last name is that same to that of a candidate, allows two slick politicians to add her name to a small town mayoral ballot.

title: The Girl Scout Story
description: A girl scout is left alone with an escaped convict.

title: No Help Wanted
description: Former stuntman and TV's "Range Rider" and "Yancy Derringer," Jock Mahoney, returns to this series, this time playing the owner of a small diner who is taken with a lost soul seemingly left alone in the rain.

title: Something About Love
description: A dancer's resolution to go on with her life as a singer inspires an architect who had become embittered after his hands were injured in the Korean war. Sally Field's mother Margaret (wife of Loretta Young show favorite Jock Mahoney) co-stars as Gene Barry's fiancée.

title: Our Sacred Honor
description: Like Spielberg's "Lincoln," which celebrated the little-known people who made a difference as well as high-profile leaders, this episode focuses on one of the lesser-known signers of the Declaration of Independence, John Hart.

title: Evil for Evil
description: An embittered man takes revenge on a beloved doctor who lost his wife on the operating table, leading to vigilantism. Among the cast is Oscar-winner Jane Darwell ("The Grapes of Wrath," "Mary Poppins"). The theme of friendly neighbors transformed into a hideous mob would be echoed in Twilight Zone episodes "The Shelter" and "The Monsters Are Due on Maple Street."

title: Three Minutes Too Late
description: A financially strapped New York cab driver becomes desperate for cash when his wife goes into labor.

title: The Girl Who Knew
description: Familiar TV faces abound in this fanciful dramedy about a woman's ability to know the time without a watch challenged by a watch company's efforts to use a conceited employee's charms to discredit her.

title: Decision
description: The wife of a pilot runs the gamut of emotions and memories while awaiting the return of her husband, whose plane has lost an engine in a storm.

title: The Refinement of 'Ab'
description: Hugh Beaumont plays the dad in one of two suburban families that allow the childish teasing between their sons escalate into a serious social and business conflicts.

title: 600 Seconds
description: A successful Art Director lets her imagination run away with her when a young female business associate of her husband's wants to talk to her about something "personal."

title: The Case of Mrs. Bannister
description: A little girl's stories about her seemingly imaginary friend, "Mrs. Bannister," begin to foreshadow real events and imminent danger.

title: Dickie
description: True story of a Depression-era mother's efforts to redirect her talented little boy's creative projects to more practical pursuits -- and who this boy turns out to be is the twist, as Ms. Young introduces the real-life man and his mom at the end of the episode.

title: Option on a Wife
description: The Hollywood success of a New York writer takes up so much of his time and attention that it threatens his marriage.

title: Tale of a Cayuse
description: A western drifter retrieves a beloved horse to court a maiden settler.

title: Case Book
description: Only a few years after "Spellbound," but before "Vertigo" and "The Three Faces of Eve," this episode uses extended two-actor scenes in its thoughtful exploration of claustrophobia and the benefits of therapy - as well as forgiveness of others and oneself.

title: Dateline: Korea
description: The plight of poverty-stricken war orphans forces a hard-nosed war correspondent to face the flesh-and-blood effects of her cynical editorials.

title: Inga II
description: Dennis Hopper was only nineteen when he appeared in this episode as a privileged young man who is sent to work on a farm to build his character.

title: Mink Coat
description: Series favorites Jock Mahoney, Ann Doran and Casey Adams (Max Showalter) reunite with Ms. Young in an amusing "Fisherman and His Wife/If You Give a Mouse A Cookie"-like fable about the effects an unexpected mink coat has on a two suburban couples.

title: Let Columbus Discover You
description: Craig Stevens plays the head of a modeling agency who likes to discover his clients in ordinary walks of life, prompting an earnest hopeful to pose as an auto mechanic to catch his attention.

title: He Always Comes Home
description: An aging man is unfaithful to his wife and negligent to his daughter.

title: Feeling No Pain
description: In a memorable episode that showcases Ms. Young's comic timing and dancing talent, she plays a passive secretary who cuts loose after a visit to the dentist and the lingering effects of laughing gas. In the scene in which she makes a grand entrance, bellowing "Anita, DAH-ling!" it strongly resembles the first appearance of Cruella DeVil in Disney's animated "101 Dalmatians."

title: I Remember the Rani
description: A British writer recalls the captivating Maharani with whom he fell in love while on assignment in India.

title: Christmas Stopover
description: This Christmas day tale of a small town waitress, lonely serviceman and the child of separated parents marks Loretta Young's first appearance on the series after many months of guest star presenters who filled in while she recovered from illness.

title: The Secret
description: John Newland becomes another series fixture as the practical, detached father of a disabled mute boy, both whom are brought out of their shells by a children's book author.

title: The Pearl
description: A middle-aged Japanese fisherman finds a pearl in an oyster and conceals it from his wife.

title: His Inheritance
description: An otherwise responsible husband and father has a periodic urge to leave his family and wander.

title: But for God's Grace
description: A mother, suffering sustained grief of losing one of her two sons, has distanced herself from her other son and husband. She becomes attached to a melancholy neighborhood boy.

title: The Cardinal's Secret
description: A young priest uses his skill as a baseball player to clear his parish of debts.

title: Double Partners
description: A deaf woman is entangled in strange and deadly events.

title: The Question
description: A real-life research project inspired this tale about a wife and mother having trouble juggling work and family when she becomes embroiled in a psychological thesis based on asking people a very telling question.

title: Little League
description: Tommy Kirk returns, this time as a youngster with his heart set on qualifying for a little league baseball team.

title: Now a Brief Word
description: A copywriter finds herself writing speeches for two opposing candidates.

title: The Years Between
description: In a taut drama that sadly still resonates today, an arrogant personnel director finds his ageist hiring policies coming back to bite him.

title: New Slant
description: A playwright works in a boys' reform school to gather material.

title: Goodbye, Goodbye
description: During a beach picnic, a widowed mother recalls when her romance with a novelist hit an unexpected snag.

title: The Great Divide
description: A woman convinced she will never marry falls for an old school friend.

title: The End of the Week
description: Just as a disillusioned schoolteacher is about to quit, she encounters classroom challenges including stolen money and a neglected student.

title: Inga IV
description: Inga Helborg returns, this time to help get an accounting job for a ex-convict who was jailed for embezzlement.

title: Somebody Else's Dream
description: A decorated veteran contends with careers that threaten his integrity, as well as an ambitious, social climbing wife.

title: Three and Two, Please
description: Sister Ann touches the lives of numerous patients she attends to at a hospital.

title: Imperfect Balance
description: A little Swiss boy suspects the respected Burgermeister of loading his scales and cheating village children.

title: Queen Nefertiti
description: While sculpting a bust of the Egyptian monarch, the artist declares his love for her, putting both of them at risk with the Pharoah.

title: My Favorite Monster
description: A sensitive little girl becomes hysterical when she sees a horror movie starring her mother's boyfriend.

title: Miss Ashley's Demon
description: A deluded Southern belle has trouble facing the truth about why she really refused her engagement.

title: Tension
description: A best selling author, who has taken to callous treatment of those he deems unimportant, finds his wife and himself in a death trap when his car hits a high tension wire.

title: Wedding Day
description: An eerie period piece about a bride suffering apparent breakdown and confusion in the wake of strange events she can't seem to piece together.

title: The Room Next Door
description: A man and woman who live in neighboring city apartments are reluctant to allow romance into their lives.

title: So Bright a Light
description: A jaded news photographer named Gretchen or "Gretch" gains new insight into the human condition when she covers the story of refugees from Budapest.

title: Legacy
description: The difficult conditions of an inheritance put a couple in conflict.

title: The Countess
description: Ken Osmond plays a young boy involved in a deadly resistance movement for a small country under military siege.

title: A Mind of Their Own
description: A top fashion designer is charmed by the owner of a budget dress line -- until she discovers his company has copied her latest designs.

title: Royal Partners: Part 1
description: One of the stars of a renowned dance duo loses her sight in a freak accident and sinks into self-pity.

title: Royal Partners: Part 2
description: A sight impaired dancer secretly trains herself in hopes of rejoining her husband/dance partner on stage again.

title: A Dollar's Worth
description: The spoiled daughter of a brash manicurist discovers that her father hadn't died when he returns from a prison sentence for forgery.

title: The Strangers That Came to Town
The Lady in the Fish Bowl
At the Edge of the Desert
